This initiative seeks to enhance mental health services by ensuring they are high-quality, accessible, and free, covering both prevention and treatment aspects.

chunk_text: * Work with the Minister of Mental Health and Addictions and Associate Minister of Health and with the support of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance to establish a permanent, ongoing Canada Mental Health Transfer, to help expand the delivery of high-quality, accessible and free mental health services, including for prevention and treatment

chunk_text: * With the support of the Minister of Seniors, negotiate agreements with provinces and territories to support efforts to improve the quality and availability of long-term care homes and beds. This includes working with provinces and territories to improve infection prevention and control measures, identify shared principles, and develop national standards and a Safe Long-Term Care Act to ensure seniors get the care they deserve

chunk_text: In support of this work, you will work with the Minister of Employment, Workforce Development and Disability Inclusion and provinces and territories to train up to 50,000 new personal support workers and raise wages

summary.summary: The initiative aims to improve access to sexual and reproductive health services for all Canadians through several key actions: enforcing compliance with the Canada Health Act, creating an information portal on sexual and reproductive rights, assisting families with in vitro fertilization costs, and backing youth-led organizations focused on addressing the specific needs of young people.

chunk_text: * With the support of the Minister for Women and Gender Equality and Youth, work to ensure that all Canadians have access to the sexual and reproductive health services they need, no matter where they live, by reinforcing compliance under the Canada Health Act, developing a sexual and reproductive health rights information portal, supporting the establishment of mechanisms to help families cover the costs of in vitro fertilization, and supporting youth-led grassroots organizations that respond to the unique sexual and reproductive health needs of young people

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the responsibility of the Minister to engage actively with cabinet and caucus colleagues to ensure effective collaboration and constructive working relationships. This is essential for delivering on platform commitments and supporting thorough, efficient cabinet decision-making.

chunk_text:
As Minister, you are also responsible for actively engaging with your cabinet
and caucus colleagues. As we deliver on our platform commitments, it will be
important that members of the ministry continue to collaborate and work
constructively to support rigorous and productive cabinet decision-making

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the importance of supporting colleagues through departmental expertise and personal experience to fulfill commitments. It highlights the need for rigorous and coordinated efforts from Ministers to effectively implement mandates. The expectation is set for Ministers to submit a proposed approach that outlines priorities, especially those for early implementation.

chunk_text:
I
expect you to support your colleagues in delivering their commitments,
leveraging the expertise of your department and your own lived experiences.

To best achieve results for Canadians, Ministers must be rigorous and
coordinated in our approach to implementation. I would therefore ask that you
return to me with a proposed approach for the delivery of your mandate
commitments, including priorities for early implementation

summary.summary: The speaker intends to hold individuals accountable for their work by requesting public reports on their progress towards commitments. This approach emphasizes the necessity of adaptation and change in governance, particularly highlighted during the pandemic.

chunk_text:
Furthermore, to
ensure we are accountable for our work, I will be asking you to publicly
report to me, and all Canadians, on your progress toward these commitments on
a regular basis.

As we have been reminded throughout the pandemic, adapting to change is not
only something government should do, it is something government must do

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the expectation for proactive consideration of new ideas and issues, including input from the public, Parliamentarians, and the public service. It stresses the importance of continuously assessing priorities in collaboration with Deputy Ministers to build a better future for all Canadians.

chunk_text:
As
you work to fulfil our commitments, I expect you to actively consider new
ideas and issues as they emerge, whether through public engagement, your work
with Parliamentarians or advice from the public service. I also expect you to
work with your Deputy Minister to assess priorities on a continual basis as we
build a better future for all Canadians

keywords: build a better future for all Canadians

summary.summary: You are responsible for managing your department's operations effectively while achieving results. Additionally, when staffing and implementing outreach strategies for federal leadership roles, it is crucial to uphold principles of equity, diversity, and inclusion to ensure federal workplaces reflect and serve all Canadians.

chunk_text:
In addition to achieving results, you
are responsible for overseeing the work of your department and ensuring the
effective operation of your portfolio.

As you staff your office and implement outreach and recruitment strategies for
federally appointed leadership positions and boards, I ask that you uphold the
principles of equity, diversity and inclusion. This helps ensure that federal
workplaces are dynamic and reflective of the Canadians we serve

summary.summary: Ensure the minister's office and department reflect a dedication to healthy and safe workplaces. Canadians expect officials to work diligently, communicate honestly, and strive to advance citizens' interests and ambitions.

chunk_text:
You will also
ensure your Minister’s office and portfolio are reflective of our commitment
to healthy and safe workplaces.

Canadians expect us to work hard, speak truthfully and be committed to
advancing their interests and aspirations

summary.summary: The text emphasizes that when mistakes occur, they should be acknowledged and learned from. The Prime Minister expresses confidence in the recipient's ability to handle responsibilities and encourages seeking support frequently. It is signed by Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada.

chunk_text:
When we make mistakes – as we all
will – Canadians expect us to acknowledge them, and most importantly, to learn
from them.

I know I can count on you to fulfill the important responsibilities entrusted
in you, and to turn to me, and the Deputy Prime Minister, early and often to
support you in your role as Minister.

Sincerely,  
Rt. Hon. Justin Trudeau, P.C., M.P.  
Prime Minister of Canada

summary.summary: The mandate letter dated December 16, 2021, addresses Minister Patty Hajdu (referred to as Minister Bennett in the text), acknowledging her role as Minister of Mental Health and Addictions and Associate Minister of Health. The letter commends Canadians for their resilience throughout the once-in-a-century pandemic and emphasizes the importance of addressing mental health and addictions during this challenging period.

chunk_text:
Minister of Mental Health and Addictions mandate letter

December 16, 2021

Dear Minister Bennett:

Thank you for agreeing to serve Canadians as Minister of Mental Health and
Addictions and Associate Minister of Health.

From the beginning of this pandemic, Canadians have faced a once-in-a-century
challenge. And through it all, from coast to coast to coast, people have met
the moment

This spirit has guided them through challenging times, and they have elected leaders who are committed to finishing the fight against COVID-19 and aiding in a robust recovery for the middle class.

When it mattered most, Canadians adapted, helped one another, and

This includes women, Indigenous Peoples, Black and
racialized Canadians, newcomers, faith-based communities, persons with

Across our work, we remain committed to ensuring that public policies are

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the importance of maintaining professional relationships with journalists to keep Canadians informed and safe, especially in light of pandemic-related adaptations by both citizens and governments. It calls for leveraging lessons from the pandemic to improve governmental responsiveness and effectiveness.

chunk_text:
I expect you to maintain professional and respectful
relationships with journalists to ensure that Canadians are well informed and
have the information they need to keep themselves and their families safe.

Throughout the course of the pandemic, Canadians and their governments have
adapted to new realities. Governments must draw on lessons learned from the
pandemic to further adapt and develop more agile and effective ways to serve
Canadians

section_title: Minister of Mental Health and Addictions mandate letter

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the need for government ministers to adapt their practices to address contemporary challenges. It also stresses the importance of collaborative efforts among parliamentarians from different parties within both the House of Commons and the Senate, aiming to achieve significant outcomes for Canadians. Ministers are expected to foster constructive relationships with Opposition Critics and coordinate legislative activities with the Leader of the Government in the House of Commons.

chunk_text:
To this end, I expect all Ministers to evaluate ways we can update
our practices to ensure our Government continues to meet the challenges of
today and tomorrow.

The success of this Parliament will require Parliamentarians, both in the
House of Commons and the Senate, to work together across all parties to get
big things done for Canadians. I expect you to maintain constructive
relationships with your Opposition Critics and coordinate any legislation with
the Leader of the Government in the House of Commons

summary.summary: The text outlines the accountability of a Minister to Parliament both individually and collectively within the cabinet. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to Open and Accountable Government principles and standards of conduct. The Minister is expected to be familiar with these guidelines, which detail expectations for each member of the Ministry. An ambitious agenda is also mentioned as part of their platform.

chunk_text:
As Minister, you are
accountable to Parliament both individually, for your style of leadership and
the performance of your responsibilities, and collectively, in support of our
Ministry and decisions taken by cabinet. Open and Accountable Government sets
out these core principles and the standards of conduct expected of you and
your office. I expect you to familiarize yourself with this document, which
outlines my expectations for each member of the Ministry.

Our platform lays out an ambitious agenda

section_title: Minister of Mental Health and Addictions mandate letter

summary.summary: The text emphasizes the need to maintain focus on combating the pandemic while also striving to strengthen the middle class and ensure equal opportunities for all. It highlights the commitment of the Minister of Mental Health and Addictions and Associate Minister of Health to work alongside the Minister of Health in addressing health disparities, with special attention given to Indigenous Peoples, Black Canadians, and other vulnerable groups.

chunk_text:
While finishing the fight against
the pandemic must remain our central focus, we must continue building a strong
middle class and work toward a better future where everyone has a real and
fair chance at success and no one is left behind.

As Minister of Mental Health and Addictions and Associate Minister of Health,
you will work with the Minister of Health to build a healthier future, with a
particular focus on ensuring that health inequities are understood and
addressed, including for Indigenous Peoples, Black Canadians and vulnerable
Canadians

summary.goal: Ensure equal status for mental health care within universal healthcare in Canada.
approach: Collaborate with provinces and territories to integrate mental health into overall healthcare systems.
Foster a whole-of-society approach to tackle problematic substance use.

commitments.objective: Establish a permanent, ongoing Canada Mental Health Transfer
partnerships: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance
aims: Expand delivery of high-quality, accessible and free mental health services including prevention and treatment

chunk_text:
You will work to ensure that mental health care is treated as a
full and equal part of our universal health care system, working in close
collaboration with provinces and territories, and lead a whole-of-society
approach to address problematic substance use in Canada.

To realize these objectives, I ask that you achieve results for Canadians by
delivering the following commitments.

  * Work with the Minister of Health, and with the support of the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, to establish a permanent, ongoing Canada Mental Health Transfer to help expand the delivery of high-quality, accessible and free mental health services, including for prevention and treatment

summary.summary: The plan aims to enhance mental health support in Canada by developing evidence-based standards with a focus on equity. It includes maintaining virtual mental health services through Wellness Together Canada, ensuring timely perinatal care access, establishing a three-digit suicide prevention hotline, and initiating a fund for student mental health to hire more counselors, reduce wait times, improve overall access, and provide targeted support for Black and racialized students.

section_title: Minister of Mental Health and Addictions mandate letter

summary.summary: Support the Minister of Indigenous Services in creating a tailored Mental Health and Wellness Strategy for First Nations, Inuit, and the Métis Nation. This includes developing culturally relevant services for addressing addiction, trauma, and suicide prevention, as well as constructing treatment facilities.

chunk_text: * Support the Minister of Indigenous Services to co-develop and invest in a distinctions-based Mental Health and Wellness Strategy to meet the needs of First Nations, Inuit and the Métis Nation, including culturally appropriate wraparound services for addiction and trauma, suicide and life promotion and the building of treatment centres

section_title: Minister of Mental Health and Addictions mandate letter

summary.summary: The text is a letter from Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, expressing confidence in the recipient's ability to handle responsibilities and learn from mistakes. It emphasizes the importance of acknowledging errors and seeking support when needed.

chunk_text:
When we make mistakes – as we all
will – Canadians expect us to acknowledge them, and most importantly, to learn
from them.

I know I can count on you to fulfill the important responsibilities entrusted
in you, and to turn to me, and the Deputy Prime Minister, early and often to
support you in your role as Minister.

Sincerely,  
Rt. Hon. Justin Trudeau, P.C., M.P.  
Prime Minister of Canada
